Dataset: Climate classification based on vegetation (Koeppen): major classes
Variables: The data variable is named Band1 - for interpretation of values, see metadata listed in data/climate_classification/readme_kpngrp.txt
Preparation steps: Unzip, convert from Esri ASCII raster format to netCDF using gdal_translate, then uncompressed netCDF3 to compressed netCDF4 using ncks

Source organisation: Australian Government Department of Agriculture and Water Resources - Australian Bureau of Agricultural and Resource Economics and Sciences (ABARES)
Temporal coverage: Published in 2018, based on other datasets mostrly spanning 2013-2016
Preparation steps: The netCDF files were generated by unzipping the shapefile bundles, converting from geoTIFF format to netCDF using gdal_translate, then uncompressed netCDF3 to compressed netCDF4 using ncks (specifying the chunk sizes for each dimension). The file aus_for18.tif.ovr was converted to aus_for18_ovr.nc and aus_for18.tif to aus_for18.nc

Variables: The extracted variables are as follows. fg10:"10 metre wind gust since previous post-processing"; u10:"10 metre U wind component"; v10:"10 metre V wind component"; d2m:"2 metre dewpoint temperature"; t2m:"2 metre temperature"; blh:"Boundary layer height"; cape:"Convective available potential energy"; lsm:"Land-sea mask"; mcpr:"Mean convective precipitation rate"; mlspr:"Mean large-scale precipitation rate"; mtpr:"Mean total precipitation rate"; swvl1:"Volumetric soil water layer 1". Further descriptions available at https://cds.climate.copernicus.eu/cdsapp#!/dataset/reanalysis-era5-single-levels?tab=overview
License: Non-restrictive ("free of charge, worldwide, non-exclusive, royalty free and perpetual") - see: https://cds.climate.copernicus.eu/api/v2/terms/static/licence-to-use-copernicus-products.pdf
Preparation steps: Spatial subsetting to the Australian region (using ncks)
Notes: Processing was undertaken on NCI, on the /g/data/rt52/era5/single-levels/reanalysis dataset. See https://geonetwork.nci.org.au/geonetwork/srv/eng/catalog.search#/metadata/f8878_3654_0839_6504

Description: Australian Gridded Climate Data (AGCD) v1.0.1/ Australian Water Availability Project (AWAP)
Source organisation: BoM (the project was a partnership between the Bureau of Rural Sciences, CSIRO, and the Bureau of Meteorology)
Purpose: Surface weather data: gridded temperature, rainfall, humidity
Variables: The extracted variables are as follows. precip:"Daily precipitation" ; tmax:"Daily maximum air temperature" ; tmin:"Daily minimum air temperature". The last of these is provided at 9am ("h09") and 3pm ("h15"). See the global attributes embedded in the netCDF files.
Notes: Copied from the NCI's data holdings (see https://geonetwork.nci.org.au/geonetwork/srv/eng/catalog.search#/metadata/f1801_8183_3094_1341)

Variables: The extracted variables are as follows. av_abl_ht:"Height above ground level of the top of the planetary boundary layer" ; av_lat_hflx:"Latent heat flux at the surface" ; av_lwsfcdown:"Downward flux of longwave radiation at the ground or ocean surface" ; av_oswrad_flx:"Outgoing shortwave radiation flux at the top of the atmosphere" ; av_qsair_scrn:"Atmospheric specific humidity at 1.5m above-ground-level (screen level)" ; av_sens_hflx:"Sensible heat flux at the surface" ; av_sfc_mois_flx:"Total moisture flux at the surface" ; av_sfc_sw_dif:"Downward diffuse shortwave radiation flux at the surface" ; av_sfc_sw_dir:"Downward direct shortwave radiation flux at the surface" ; av_swsfcdown:"Downward flux of shortwave radiation at the ground or ocean surface" ; av_temp_scrn:"Atmospheric air temperature at 1.5m above ground-level (screen level)" ; av_ttl_cld:"Total cloud coverage calculated with a maximum-random overlap assumption" ; av_uwnd10m:"Zonal (U) component of the wind velocity at 10m above-ground-level" ; av_vwnd10m:"Meridional (V) component of the wind velocity at 10m above-ground-level" ; av_wndgust10m:"Gust windspeed at 10m above-ground-level" ; dewpt_scrn:"Dewpoint temperature at 1.5m above ground level (screen level)".
Notes: Copied from the NCI's data holdings (see https://geonetwork.nci.org.au/geonetwork/srv/eng/catalog.search#/metadata/f2420_7266_3556_7996

Dataset: Digital elevation model at 9 arcsecond (~250m) resolution
Source organisation: Bioregional Assessment Program: The Australian Government's bioregional assessments programs are a collaboration between the Department of Agriculture, Water and the Environment, the Bureau of Meteorology, CSIRO and Geoscience Australia.
Variables: The 'Band1' variable in the netCDF file is the height above sea level in metres.
Preparation steps: The netCDF files were generated by unzipping the shapefile bundles, converting from geoTIFF format to netCDF using gdal_translate, then uncompressed netCDF3 to compressed netCDF4 using ncks (specifying the chunk sizes for each dimension).

Dataset: Digital elevation model at 3 arcsecond (~90m) resolution
Source organisation: Bioregional Assessment Program: The Australian Government's bioregional assessments programs are a collaboration between the Department of Agriculture, Water and the Environment, the Bureau of Meteorology, CSIRO and Geoscience Australia.

Description: Land use of Australia raster package, 2015-2016 edition
Source organisation: ABARES (Australian Bureau of Agricultural and Resource Economics and Sciences)
Temporal coverage: Based on source data from around 2015-2016 (published 2022)

Dataset: Remotely sensed fire locations - geostationary only
Description: Remotely sensed fire locations, Himawari-8, Wildfire Automated Biomass Burning Algorithm (WF_ABBA) processing
Purpose: Remote mapping of fire locations and intensities
Variables: The relevant ones are as follows: satellite, latitude,longitude,temp_kelvin,power,confidence,datetime. The geocoordinates are for the centre of the ~2km pixels.
URLs: https://hotspots.dea.ga.gov.au/files/historic   for the dataset and    https://www.ssd.noaa.gov/PS/FIRE/Layers/ABBA/abba_2008Aug21.html for the processing

Dataset: Remotely sensed fire locations - geostationary and orbiting sensors
Description: Remotely sensed fire locations: MODIS (Terra+AQUA), VIIRS (NOAA20+Suomi NPP), AVHRR (NOAA19), Himawari 8/9
Purpose: Remote mapping of fire locations and intensities
Variables: The relevant ones are as follows: satellite, latitude,longitude,temp_kelvin,power,confidence,datetime. The geocoordinates are for the centre of the ~2km pixels.

Dataset: Remotely sensed fire locations - AVHRR sensors only
Purpose: Remote mapping of fire locations and intensities
Variables: The relevant ones are as follows: satellite, latitude,longitude,temp_kelvin,power,confidence,datetime. The geocoordinates are for the centre of the ~2km pixels.

Description: Interim Biogeographic Regionalisation for Australia (IBRA), Version 7
Source organisation: Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water

Description: MODIS/Terra+Aqua Land Cover Type Yearly L3 Global 0.05 Deg CMG
License: ?? seems to be free ?? Maybe someone can follow up??
Preparation steps: Extracted via the USGS OpenDAP API
Notes: This provides three different land-use classifications: based on IGBP classes (0-16), UMD classes (0-15), and LAI classes (0-10). Class descriptions are provided in the variable attributes in the netCDF files.
